name: git-blame-w77
description: It is an extension for VS code, which can show git blame in editor and can run git gui blame.

gitBlameW77.colors.description: Specifies colors for the blame decoration. If use empty array then is setup color 'editor.foreground' from theme.

gitBlameW77.colorsUsedAsBackground.description: Specifies whether colors are used as background of decoration. Default colors are used as text of decoration.

gitBlameW77.gitBlameUrl.description: Specifies git blame URL e.g 'https://github.com/wojtek77/git-blame-w77/commit/${hash}'. When it is NULL (default) it tries to automatically find the URL. When there is an empty string it disables this functionality. This functionality degrades performance when rendering decorations.

gitBlameW77.dateLocale.description: Specifies locale for date e.g 'en-US'. More locales here https://www.w3schools.com/jsref/jsref_tolocalestring.asp or https://stackoverflow.com/questions/27939773/tolocaledatestring-short-format. When there is an empty string (default) then it take locale from system.

gitBlameW77.decorationShowHash.description: Specifies whether to show commit hash or not in decoration.

commands.title: Run Git Gui Blame For Line

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
